channel.title: Mopar Weekly (#1)
channel.description:
[size=24pt]News (for the week 01/06/2015)[/size] [size=18pt]Chat Server Upgrades[/size] Some of you have be aware that recently the IRC server was hit by a string of DDOS attacks. This has been the reason for any downtime/connection issues experienced. This has led to a host migration and t4 is now responsible for the server. We now have two nodes with one in Europe and one in America which is set to launch soon.
[hr]
[size=18pt]Tutorials/Snippets[/size]
[size=14pt][url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,669365.0.html]Clan Chat for Hyperion[/url] (by [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=540458]Dan0194[/url])[/size] Dan recently posted a comprehensive copy+paste style tutorial on how to add fully functional clan chats to the Hyperion base. He covers both the client and server aspects of the feature. All topped off with a video of the final product which looks amazing!
[img]http://i.imgur.com/LReYQFg.png[/img]
[size=14pt][url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,669926.0.html]Item Definitions for Asteria 2.0[/url] (by [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=438237]Fridder[/url])[/size] This is an awesome contribution which features 20,000+ item definitions for the popular Asteria base, alongside how to implement it.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/xcvMYa4.png[/img]
[hr]
[size=18pt]Client Hacking[/size]
[size=14pt][url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,670167.0.html]RuneTek 4 Engine Rewrite[/url] (by [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=449007]sini[/url])[/size] Sini has recently began rewriting the RuneTek 4 engine for use in the offcial private server. Make sure you keep up with his progress!
[img]http://i.imgur.com/4hUvsSs.png[/img]
[hr]
[size=18pt]Downloads[/size]
[size=14pt][url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,670032.0.html]RS838 Emulation[/url] (by [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=609368]Sir James1996[/url])[/size] James is back with another emulation of the current RuneScape protocol. Although not complete, it has quite a bit of basic functionality and should serve as a good base for those wanting to dabble in this protocol.

item.title: Mopar Weekly (#1)
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Could an administrator give Pure access to the Mopar Monthly board that John and I had? I think we had some good information in there, although I haven’t checked it for quite some time.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Weekly (#1)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yeah, I agree with carrying on from what Flame_ began. Was pretty cool.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Weekly (#1)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:15, topic:551785”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670699.msg4484874#msg4484874 date=1433350692]

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=670699.msg4484802#msg4484802 date=1433272545]

Nice post, looking forward to more. If you guys have any suggestions for tutorials/downloads to be mentioned I’m sure Pure would love to hear them.

When we had that other home page crap (I forget the name of it) I liked when John (Flame_) was posting about the recent servers and learning a bit about some of the more “higher up” community members.

Perhaps it could include constant section on the Official server, giving it’s latest patches and updates; to show people it’s active and maybe get some more interest in that… Posting some other ‘trending’ server development topics would give some users extra recognition as well.
[/quote]I can continue the interviewing of senior members. As tom said make sure you post stuff you want to see in the next weekly update as a reply to this thread and they will be considered. I’ll also talk to sinisoul regarding updates about the server but I doubt consistent progress is made every week on it, it’s exam season after all

edit: Feel free to brainstorm ideas about what to ask these senior community members, I’ll be sure to get around to it for next weeks update. A proper format will be worked on before a continuation of this series.
i.e. a little about themselves now, what they are known for, what do they do nowadays, how did they find the community, etc

some questions: (None specific, can be done better/etc)

  1. What got you into the RSPS scene?

  2. What makes you stay here at moparscape?

  3. What is your advice to newcomers that don’t know how to program well?
    [/quote]protip none of them stay at moparscape
    I don’t suppose anybody knows who was interviewed before so I don’t repeat old ones?[/quote]
    stay as in log in once in a while xD
    or sit in the irc.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Weekly (#1)
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[size=24pt]News (for the week 01/06/2015)[/size]
[size=18pt]Chat Server Upgrades[/size]
Some of you have be aware that recently the IRC server was hit by a string of DDOS attacks. This has been the reason for any downtime/connection issues experienced.
This has led to a host migration and t4 is now responsible for the server. We now have two nodes with one in Europe and one in America which is set to launch soon.

[hr]

[size=18pt]Tutorials/Snippets[/size]

[size=14pt]Clan Chat for Hyperion (by Dan0194)[/size]
Dan recently posted a comprehensive copy+paste style tutorial on how to add fully functional clan chats to the Hyperion base. He covers both the client and server aspects of the feature. All topped off with a video of the final product which looks amazing!

[size=14pt]Item Definitions for Asteria 2.0 (by Fridder)[/size]
This is an awesome contribution which features 20,000+ item definitions for the popular Asteria base, alongside how to implement it.

[hr]

[size=18pt]Client Hacking[/size]

[size=14pt]RuneTek 4 Engine Rewrite (by sini)[/size]
Sini has recently began rewriting the RuneTek 4 engine for use in the offcial private server. Make sure you keep up with his progress!

[hr]

[size=18pt]Downloads[/size]

[size=14pt]RS838 Emulation (by Sir James1996)[/size]
James is back with another emulation of the current RuneScape protocol. Although not complete, it has quite a bit of basic functionality and should serve as a good base for those wanting to dabble in this protocol.

Read full topic
